byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Riyadh, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.
byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and NEIL MacFARQUHAR

abstract: News Analysis; King Salman of Saudi Arabia rearranges order of royal succession, placing security and counterterrorism experts Prince Mohammed bin Nayef and Prince Mohammed bin Salman next in line; move, prompted by concerns over Iran's nuclear program and infirmity of original top princes, carries potential to reshape kingdom and its relations with United States; new leaders have shown little interest in democratic reforms.
lead_paragraph: With Saudi Arabia locked in proxy wars with Iran, King Salman put the two princes most responsible for the kingdom’s security into the line of succession.

headline.main: A Saudi Royal Shake-Up With a Goal of Stability
headline.print_headline: A Saudi Royal Shake-Up With a Goal of Stability

snippet: With Saudi Arabia locked in proxy wars with Iran, King Salman put the two princes most responsible for the kingdom’s security into the line of succession.
